website_summaries.verdict: You don't get much in the way of storage space, but this CamelBak is an excellent choice for people who are primarily concerned about portable hydration.
pros: Minimalist, lightweight design holds 3 liters of water (around a gallon) and even has a small pocket for a tiny accessory or two
Does not bounce, slosh or slow you down
cons: This is not the hydration backpack to get if you need to carry accessories such as bicycle tubes, changes of clothing, etc

customer_reviews.title: Updated review...
customer_reviews.text: The materials used is top notch, and the construction is excellent. The zippers are great, and the pull tabs on them are convenient. The bite valve covering and on/off switch are great designs. The bladder compartment is large enough to insert a couple power bars...very nice. No rubber after tasting water either! I figured out how to adjust the sternum strap...prior to that, it was very uncomfortable to wear. That's why I'd rated it with 4 Stars, but now it's a definite 5...after I figured it out.
customer_reviews.author: Branden M.

customer_reviews.title: I did not need the waist belt clipped and wore it more like a book bag
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this item 5 stars because it worked perfectly for my use. I went to EDC NYC this year (2016). I needed to stay hydrated and didnt want to wait in line all day for refills. Filling this thing up gave me and 4 friends enough water all day (one additional refill).... I am a large man and the straps fit me well. I did not need the waist belt clipped and wore it more like a book bag, I will say that it looked like there was plenty of room for adjustment on all straps, and didnt cause any discomfort for the 7 hours at the festival (never even switched carrier)
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Great for those long days on a trail
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a high capacity but not bulky hydration pack and this one fit the bill nicely. The pack is very adjustable and the material is pretty rugged and durable. customer_reviews.title: CamelBak ThermoBak
customer_reviews.text: Greatly impressed with this product! Keeps water cold for a very impressive amount of time and is of fantastic quality. Insulated tube and bite valve cover along with the quick connect system and shut off valve are great touches of this CamelBak and are one of the biggest reasons I decided on this over others. Five stars, great product! Worth the money, fantastic quality of everything pack and bladder.

customer_reviews.text: I've used it several times, so not too heavy usage, but I have enough to say the quality of this is unmatched by any competitors. Buy a camelbak or don't buy a hydration pack. My only complaint for this product is that for the first few uses, the water does taste a bit funny like rubber/plastic but this is no issue or danger so I can tolerate this. Otherwise, perfect hydration pack to store water, with an additional pocket where I like to store my small notebook and papers from briefings/lessons. My friends said they loved mine. They get the boring old/used standard issue ones, but I have the flawless and fancy Camelbak.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Came in good condition, including 2 cleaning tablets although the little arm thingeys for drying the bladder were missing. All in all great bag, the stitching fantastic, although major face palm on my part ... did not anticipate the lack of cargo space. The bag rides comfortably on my rides, no swaying of the bag due to the massive amounts of water on my bag. The D rings seem to be load bearing ... have not broken on me with a consistent 10kg load on long rides. The bladder does not leak and the bite valve still works. Took a while to figure out how to remove the bladder, which requires some force.
